page.title: 20The Maritime Museum
page.content: A very important factor in the development of the area is its proximity to the sea and this has now been recognised by the opening of a Maritime Museum on 10.7.85. The museum is housed in the old Custom House on St.George's Quay. The quay was vital to early trade particularly with the West Indies and this resulted in the Custom House being built in 1764.After the decline of Lancaster as a port the quay fell into disrepair but is now being restored and is becoming a popular tourist attraction. 1000 people visited the museum in its first 5 days. As well as displaying the history of trade with the W.Indies it also gives valuable insight into the fishing industry of the area.2 period rooms are in the museum, one showing an (18 Custom Office another a (20 Morecambe Bay cottage kitchen.
